sub_topic: Calculating the percent composition of inorganic compounds
message_1: What is the percent composition of sodium chloride (NaCl)?
message_2:
To find the percent composition of sodium chloride (NaCl), we need to determine the mass of each element (sodium and chlorine) and then divide it by the total mass of the compound.

First, we need to find the molar mass of each element:
- Sodium (Na): 22.99 g/mol
- Chlorine (Cl): 35.45 g/mol

Now, we can find the molar mass of NaCl by adding the molar masses of sodium and chlorine:
Molar mass of NaCl = 22.99 g/mol (Na) + 35.45 g/mol (Cl) = 58.44 g/mol

Next, we will find the percent composition of each element in NaCl:

Percent composition of sodium (Na):
(22.99 g/mol Na) / (58.44 g/mol NaCl) * 100% = 39.34%

Percent composition of chlorine (Cl):
(35.45 g/mol Cl) / (58.44 g/mol NaCl) * 100% = 60.66%

So, the percent composition of sodium chloride (NaCl) is approximately 39.34% sodium (Na) and 60.66% chlorine (Cl).
